user.description:
Setup your Better Thermostat to integrate with Home Assistant
**If you need more info: [documentation]({config_url})**

data.name: Name
data.off_temperature: The outdoor temperature when the thermostat should turn off
data.tolerance: Tolerance, to prevent the thermostat from turning on and off too often
data.window_off_delay: Delay before the thermostat should turn off when the window is opened
data.window_off_delay_after: Delay before the thermostat should turn on when the window is closed
data.weather: Weather entity to get the outdoor temperature

data_description.presets: Select the presets you want to be available for this thermostat.

data.heat_auto_swapped: If 'auto' means 'heat' for your TRV and you want to swap it
data.child_lock: Ignore all inputs on the TRV like a child lock
data.homematicip: If you use HomematicIP, you should enable this to slow down the requests to prevent the duty cycle
data.valve_maintenance: If your thermostat has no own maintenance mode, you can use this one
data.no_off_system_mode: If your TRV doesn't support the 'off' mode, enable this to use target temperature 5°C instead

data_description.protect_overheating: Some TRVs don't close the valve completely when the temperature is reached. Or the radiator has a lot of rest heat. This can cause overheating. This option can prevent this.
data_description.calibration_mode:
How the calibration is calculated
***Normal***: Uses your external temperature sensor to correct the TRV's internal sensor. Simple and reliable for most setups.
***Aggressive***: Similar to Normal, but pushes the TRV harder to reach temperature faster. Good if your room heats slowly.
***Time Based***: Learns your room's heating patterns over time and adjusts automatically. Balances comfort and efficiency.
***MPC Predictive***: Advanced algorithm that predicts temperature changes and optimizes valve position. Best for stable, efficient heating with minimal overshooting. Learns your room's thermal behavior.
***PID Controller***: Classic control method that responds to temperature errors. Good for systems with varying heating power or external disturbances.
***TPI Controller***: Calculates heating duty cycles based on temperature difference. Simple and effective for consistent heating patterns.
data_description.calibration:
How the calibration is applied on the TRV
***Target Temperature Based***: Apply the calibration to the target temperature.
***Offset Based***: Apply the calibration to the temperature offset.

confirm.title: Confirm adding a Better Thermostat
confirm.description:
You are about to add `{name}` to Home Assistant.
With {trv} as the real Thermostat

error.no_off_mode:
Your device is special and has no off mode :(
Better Thermostat will use the minimal target temp instead.
error.no_outside_temp: You have no outside temperature sensor. Better Thermostat will use the weather entity instead.

abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single Better Thermostat is allowed for each real thermostat.
abort.no_devices_found: No thermostat entity found, make sure you have a climate entity in your Home Assistant

confirm.title: The related entity {entity} is missing
confirm.description:
The reason for this is that the entity ({entity}) is not available in your Home Assistant.

You can fix this by checking if the battery of the device is full or reconnecting it to HA. Make sure that the entity is back in HA before you continue.

degraded_mode.title: BT: {name} - running in degraded mode
degraded_mode.description:
Better Thermostat is running in degraded mode because some sensors are unavailable: {sensors}

The thermostat will continue to operate with reduced functionality. For example:
- If the room temperature sensor is unavailable, the TRV's internal sensor will be used instead.
- If window sensors are unavailable, windows are assumed to be closed.
- If outdoor/weather sensors are unavailable, heating will always be enabled.

Check if the affected devices have battery issues or connectivity problems.

invalid_window_state.title: BT: {name} - invalid window sensor state
invalid_window_state.description:
The window sensor for Better Thermostat {name} reported an unrecognized state: {state}.

Expected states are: 'on', 'off', 'true', 'false', 'open', 'closed'.

Please check your window sensor configuration.

save_current_target_temperature.description: Save the current target temperature for later restore.

reset_heating_power.description: Reset heating power to default value.

set_temp_target_temperature.name: Set eco temperature
set_temp_target_temperature.description: Set the target temperature to a temporary like night mode, and save the old one.
